messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: there are [0-9]+ clusters'

Imagine a world with 16 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, and 7. Room 2 is connected to rooms 1, 3, 4, and 16. Room 3 is connected to rooms 1, 2, 4 and 5. Room 4 is also connected to rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14. Room 5 is connected to rooms 6, 7, 8, and 3. Room 6 is connected to rooms 5, 7, 8, and 12. Room 7 is connected to rooms 1, 8, 6, and 5. Room 8 is also connected to rooms 5, 6, 7, and 10. Room 9 is connected to rooms 10, 11,12, and 15. Room 10 is connected to rooms 9, 11, 8, and 12. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13, 9, 12, and 10. Room 12 is also connected to rooms 9, 10, 11, and 6. Room 13 is connected to rooms 14, 15, 16, and 11. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 13, 15, 16. Room 15 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 16, and 9. Room 16 is also connected to rooms 13, 14, 15, and 2. How many densely-connected clusters of rooms are there in this world? A densely-connected cluster is a group of rooms that are connected to themselves with a minimum of 2 rooms.

Okay, here's my response
Step number the first
Thinking outside like the following is what I love (see picture if it were physical cluster maps-see reference attachment):    From above description here you have total eight connected paths with all those rooms-room numbers in those respective paths would make it harder as there are rooms as path numbers   But this has rooms as connection points between clusters or rather a spaghetti-like situation: from analysis above it's a bit dense on that area but in broad categorization clusters I did manage with 3.    I had been trying out visuals in three separate locations where they just branch into densest areas as per what can gather here but these tend to have two connections each of all the rest, including itself    From this type of layout a clustering is hard 
There are no  clusters which as connected nodes tend to overlap in regions due    Due note how a  2 or 8 like pattern on above can's have at one extreme of either but if you go close they separate to their corresponding opposite side like what one visual cluster tries though in between those overlain regions a single "island" at all or some cases and that tend to keep same side connection from room, I  tend use just single region so 
Let look a what i did visual and get an outline as described above, with room connections represented visually then.
Now we move on with denser connected. There three of dense or what connect rooms of room like cluster which tend   have self containments, such these rooms as 

The  Clusters: rooms1 +room number like   this    cluster  2 : room 5+8 so densely  pack together, rooms on out   4+0 cluster rooms   on interior or exterior areas of these clustered or outside like on other path sections    this are my  final three visual connected group clusters of connected rooms in the whole:                              - rooms  rooms + room  5-     cluster   of dense connected interior -   

Room numbers  can represented below 0 indexed based but visual c   to room connections where, based  
   Final Visual Closter  Outlines:  The there dense visual connected group rooms  Final outcome : Room are three : Clustewr   Ck : R0  ( interoor,Room_5, dens elyt connectd)(ex.,6 to2 then to9):  R(room2(0), denset inter, R2):Rooms(2-5 all)(c1 dense inter) C1;   0
